001package org.biopax.ols.impl;
002
003import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
004import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
005import org.biopax.ols.Parser;
006import org.obo.dataadapter.OBOAdapter;
007import org.obo.dataadapter.OBOFileAdapter;
008import org.obo.datamodel.*;
009import org.obo.util.TermUtil;
010
011import java.util.Collection;
012import java.util.HashMap;
013import java.util.HashSet;
014import java.util.Set;
015
016/**
017 * Abstract base class to interact with OBOEdit codebase and parse OBO files
018 *
019 * @author Richard Cote
020 * @version $Id: AbstractParser.java,v 1.9 2008/04/16 13:49:44 rglcote Exp $
021 */
022public class OBO2FormatParser implements Parser {
023    private static Log logger = LogFactory.getLog(OBO2FormatParser.class);
024
025    private OBOSession session;
026
027    public OBO2FormatParser(String filePath) throws Exception {
028        OBOFileAdapter adapter = new OBOFileAdapter();
029        OBOFileAdapter.OBOAdapterConfiguration config = new OBOFileAdapter.OBOAdapterConfiguration();
030        config.getReadPaths().add(filePath);
031        session = adapter.doOperation(OBOAdapter.READ_ONTOLOGY, config, null);
032    }
033
034    public OBO2FormatParser(Collection<String> filePaths) throws Exception {
035        OBOFileAdapter adapter = new OBOFileAdapter();
036        OBOFileAdapter.OBOAdapterConfiguration config = new OBOFileAdapter.OBOAdapterConfiguration();
037        config.getReadPaths().addAll(filePaths);
038        session = adapter.doOperation(OBOAdapter.READ_ONTOLOGY, config, null);
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * returns all the terms parsed from an ontology
043     *
044     * @return a set of OBOClass/Instance objects, or null if session is not initialized
045     */
046    public Set<OBOObject> getTerms() {
047        LinkDatabase lnkDb = session.getLinkDatabase();
048        HashSet<OBOObject> terms = new HashSet<>();
049        for (IdentifiedObject io : lnkDb.getObjects()) {
050            //do not return built-in obo: constructs
051            if ((io instanceof OBOClass || io instanceof Instance) 
052                        && !io.getID().toLowerCase().startsWith("obo:")) {
053                terms.add((OBOObject) io);
054            }
055        }
056        return terms;
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * returns the OBOSession of the underlying parser
061     *
062     * @return the OBOSession object
063     */
064    public OBOSession getSession() {
065        return session;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * returns the root terms of an ontology
070     *
071     * @return a collection of OBOClass terms
072     * @throws IllegalStateException if the session is not initialized
073     */
074    public Set<OBOObject> getRootTerms(boolean useGreedy) {
075
076        HashSet<OBOObject> roots = new HashSet<>();
077        /*
078             * {@link RootAlgorithm#GREEDY GREEDY} root algorithm.
079         *
080         * @param linkDatabase
081         *            the linkDatabase to check
082         * @param includeTerms
083         *            whether to include root terms
084         * @param includeProperties
085         *            whether to include root properties
086         * @param includeObsoletes
087         *            whether to include obsolete terms & properties
088         * @param includeInstances
089         *            whether to include instances
090         */
091
092        if (useGreedy) {
093            //use greedy root detection
094            // returns all non-obsolete root terms in a given LinkDatabase
095            Collection<OBOClass> tmpRoots = TermUtil.getRoots(session);
096            roots.addAll(tmpRoots);
097        } else {
098            //use strict root detection
099            Collection<LinkedObject> tmpRoots = TermUtil.getRoots(RootAlgorithm.STRICT, session.getLinkDatabase());
100            for (LinkedObject lnk : tmpRoots) {
101                if (lnk instanceof OBOClass) {
102                    roots.add((OBOClass) lnk);
103                }
104            }
105        }
106
107        return roots;
108    }
109
110
111    /**
112     * Will compute all the term paths from a given term to all its children, irrespective of distance
113     *
114     * @param distance         Distance in arcs between nodes. Set to 1 to begin, will be incremented in recursive method calls
115     * @param term             The term to scan for a given distance
116     * @param relationshipType - a set of possible synonyms for the type of relationship to link the terms (is_a, part_of, develops_from)
117     * @return A hashmap where the key is a term ID and the value is an Integet repersenting the distance
118     */
119    private HashMap<String, Integer> computeChildPaths(int distance, Set relationshipType, LinkedObject term,
120                                                       HashMap<String, Integer> paths)
121    {
122        //get all children
123        Collection<Link> children = term.getChildren();
124
125        //iterate over children
126        for (Link trm : children) {
127            //add relationship
128            if (relationshipType.contains(trm.getType().getID())) {
129                paths.put(trm.getChild().getID(), distance);
130                //we're building up the map here, so we don't care about the return
131                try {
132                    computeChildPaths(distance + 1, relationshipType, trm.getChild(), paths);
133                } catch (StackOverflowError e) {
134                    logger.error("Stack overflow when computing child paths for: " + term.getID() + " for relationships: " + relationshipType);
135                    throw new IllegalStateException(e);
136                }
137            }
138        }
139
140        return paths;
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * Will compute all the term paths from a given term to all its children, irrespective of distance
145     *
146     * @param distance         Distance in arcs between nodes. Set to 1 to begin, will be incremented in recursive method calls
147     * @param relationshipType - a set of possible synonyms for the type of relationship to link the terms (is_a, part_of, develops_from)
148     * @param term             The term to scan for a given distance
149     * @return A hashmap where the key is a term ID and the value is an Integet repersenting the distance
150     */
151    public HashMap<String, Integer> computeChildPaths(int distance, Set relationshipType, LinkedObject term) {
152        //the true call is required only once, at each call
153        return computeChildPaths(distance, relationshipType, term, new HashMap<>());
154    }
155
156}
